--- execute: freeze: true title: 'Appendix 1: Supplementary tables and figures' --- ### Data #### The German protest registrations dataset :::{.column-page} \begingroup \scriptsize\selectfont \csvautobooktabular[separator=semicolon,respect sharp=true]{/Users/david/Repositories/protest-impact/report/tables/gpreg-overview.csv} \endgroup ::: Table: Overview of the German Protest Registrations (GPReg) dataset. _kpop_ = population in 1000; _cap?_ = whether the city is the political capital of its region; _reg?_ = whether the number of registered protesters (as per the organizers) is available; _obs?_ = whether the number of observed protesters (as per the police) is available; _incl?_ = whether the data is used in this thesis. #### Sociodemographic variables {#sec-app-sociodem} ::: {#d63ed3d9 .cell execution_count=2} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=16} - Anteil Personen mit MHG 0 bis 19 Jahre (%) - Anteil Personen mit MHG 60 Jahre und älter (%) - Erwerbstätigenquote Frauen (%) - Erwerbstätigenquote Männer (%) - Anteil Einpersonenhaushalte (%) - Haushalte mit Kindern (%) - Elterngeldbezug Vater (%) - Wahlbeteiligung, Europawahl (%) - Verfügbares Einkommen je EW (EUR) - BIP je Erwerbstätigen (EUR) - Armutsgefährdungsquote (Bundesmedian) (%) - Bevölkerungsdichte (EW je qkm) - Anteil der ausländischen Bevölkerung an der Gesamtbevölkerung (%) - Wanderungssaldo je 10.000 EW - Bevölkerung 0 bis 17 Jahre (%) - Bevölkerung 65 Jahre und älter (%) - Durchschnittsalter der Bevölkerung - Anteil Schulabgänger/-innen mit allgem. Hochschulreife (%) - Anteil Schulabgänger/-innen ohne Hauptschulabschluss (%) - Gewerbeanmeldungen je 10.000 EW - Zweitstimmenanteil CDU/CSU, Bundestagswahl (%) - Zweitstimmenanteil SPD, Bundestagswahl (%) - Zweitstimmenanteil FDP, Bundestagswahl (%) - Zweitstimmenanteil GRÜNE, Bundestagswahl (%) - Zweitstimmenanteil DIE LINKE, Bundestagswahl (%) - Wahlbeteiligung, Bundestagswahl (%) - Zweitstimmenanteil AfD, Bundestagswahl (%) - Arbeitslosenquote (%) - Pkw-Bestand je 1.000 EW am 01.01. ::: ::: #### Queries for retrieving article counts {#sec-app-queries} :::{.column-page} \begingroup \footnotesize\selectfont \csvautobooktabular[separator=comma,respect all]{/Users/david/Repositories/protest-impact/report/tables/queries.csv} \endgroup ::: Table: Queries for retrieving article counts from online and print newspapers. The words for each category are joined by `OR` operators, and the resulting sub-queries are further combined as described in @sec-data-discourse. The query for the protest events is adapted from @wiedemannGeneralizedApproachProtest2022. ### Results #### Regression {#sec-app1-reg} \begingroup \footnotesize\selectfont ::: {#d580d7df .cell fig-caption='Detailed results for the best regression model from @sec-res-reg. Dependent variable is the absolute number of articles mentioning climate change from the treatment date and the following day. Due to including time series lags there are overall 140 parameters plus a constant term, so only the 20 parameters with lowest p-values are displayed. Note that for the weekday dummies the first value (Friday) is dropped and the other dummies are to be interpreted in relation to it.' fig-label='fig-reg-details' execution_count=4} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ```{=html}
OLS Regression Results
Dep. Variable: media_combined_all R-squared: 0.870
Model: OLS Adj. R-squared: 0.868
Method: Least Squares F-statistic: 232.6
Date: Sat, 19 Aug 2023 Prob (F-statistic): 0.00
Time: 15:37:44 Log-Likelihood: -48958.
No. Observations: 9490 AIC: 9.816e+04
Df Residuals: 9369 BIC: 9.902e+04
Df Model: 120
Covariance Type: HC3
``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ```{=html}
